intro: Citheroxylon niveum, commonly known as the silver tree, is a unique plant native to the island of Madagascar. It is a member of the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant has a thick, woody trunk with a smooth, bark-like surface. Its leaves are small, leathery, and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Citheroxylon niveum is adapted to arid conditions, making it a hardy species found in dry, rocky habitats.
